storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to detect overlapping bookings to avoid double scheduling of resources

testCases.title: Detect overlapping booking and prevent confirmation
preconditions: Scheduler user is logged in with valid credentials
Scheduling system is operational and accessible
At least one resource exists in the system with an active booking
Existing booking: Resource 'Conference Room A' booked from 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM on current date
Scheduler has permission to create and modify bookings
Conflict detection service is running and responsive

steps.action: Navigate to the booking creation page
steps.expectedResult: Booking form is displayed with fields for resource selection, date, start time, and end time

steps.action: Select resource 'Conference Room A' from the resource dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Resource 'Conference Room A' is selected and displayed in the form

steps.action: Enter current date in the date field
steps.expectedResult: Date is populated correctly in the date field

steps.action: Enter start time as 10:15 AM and end time as 10:45 AM (overlapping with existing 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM booking)
steps.expectedResult: Time values are entered in the respective fields

steps.action: Click 'Submit' or 'Confirm Booking' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays conflict warning message indicating 'Resource Conference Room A is already booked from 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM' and booking confirmation button is disabled or blocked

steps.action: Verify that the booking cannot be saved by attempting to click confirm again
steps.expectedResult: Booking remains unconfirmed and system continues to display conflict warning

steps.action: Modify the start time to 11:00 AM and end time to 12:00 PM (non-overlapping slot)
steps.expectedResult: Updated time values are displayed in the form fields

steps.action: Click 'Submit' or 'Confirm Booking' button
steps.expectedResult: System allows booking confirmation without warnings, displays success message, and booking is saved successfully

steps.action: Navigate to conflict logs section or access logs via API endpoint GET /api/conflicts/logs
steps.expectedResult: Conflict logs interface or API response is displayed

steps.action: Search for conflict log entry related to 'Conference Room A' for the attempted booking at 10:15 AM - 10:45 AM
steps.expectedResult: Conflict log entry is present showing resource 'Conference Room A', attempted time slot 10:15 AM - 10:45 AM, timestamp of conflict detection, and scheduler user details

postconditions: Original booking for Conference Room A from 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM remains unchanged
New booking for Conference Room A from 11:00 AM to 12:00 PM is successfully created
Conflict attempt is logged in the system with complete metadata
No double booking exists for Conference Room A

testCases.title: Verify conflict detection latency under 1 second
preconditions: Scheduler user is logged in with valid credentials
Scheduling system is operational with normal load
Performance monitoring tools are available and configured
Existing booking: Resource 'Meeting Room B' booked from 2:00 PM to 3:00 PM on current date
System clock is synchronized and accurate
Network latency is within normal operational parameters

steps.action: Open browser developer tools or performance monitoring tool to track response times
steps.expectedResult: Performance monitoring tool is active and recording network requests

steps.action: Navigate to booking creation page and fill in resource 'Meeting Room B', current date, start time 2:15 PM, end time 2:45 PM
steps.expectedResult: Booking form is populated with conflicting time slot details

steps.action: Note the current timestamp and click 'Submit' or 'Check Availability' button
steps.expectedResult: System initiates conflict detection request to POST /api/schedule/check-conflict endpoint

steps.action: Measure the time elapsed from submission to conflict warning display using performance monitoring tool
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detection processing completes and response is received within 1 second (1000 milliseconds)

steps.action: Observe the UI response and verify conflict warning is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Conflict warning message appears immediately on screen without noticeable delay, displaying 'Resource Meeting Room B is already booked from 2:00 PM to 3:00 PM'

steps.action: Verify the booking confirmation button state
steps.expectedResult: Booking confirmation button is disabled or blocked, preventing save action

steps.action: Attempt to click the disabled confirmation button
steps.expectedResult: Booking cannot be saved, system displays message indicating conflict must be resolved first

steps.action: Review performance monitoring logs to confirm exact latency measurement
steps.expectedResult: Recorded latency shows conflict detection API response time is less than 1000 milliseconds

postconditions: Conflict detection completed within performance requirements
Booking remains unsaved due to unresolved conflict
System performance metrics are recorded for analysis
User is prevented from creating double booking

testCases.title: Ensure system logs all detected conflicts
preconditions: Scheduler user is logged in with valid credentials
Admin user credentials are available for log access
Logging service is operational and connected to database
Existing booking: Resource 'Projector Unit 5' booked from 9:00 AM to 10:00 AM on current date
Conflict logs database is accessible and has sufficient storage
System time is synchronized for accurate timestamp recording

steps.action: Navigate to booking creation page as Scheduler user
steps.expectedResult: Booking form is displayed and ready for input

steps.action: Create a conflicting booking attempt by selecting resource 'Projector Unit 5', current date, start time 9:30 AM, end time 10:30 AM
steps.expectedResult: Form is populated with conflicting booking details

steps.action: Click 'Submit' button to trigger conflict detection
steps.expectedResult: System detects conflict and displays warning message blocking the booking confirmation

steps.action: Note the exact time of conflict detection for verification purposes
steps.expectedResult: Current timestamp is recorded for comparison with log entry

steps.action: Log in as Admin user or switch to admin interface
steps.expectedResult: Admin dashboard is displayed with access to system logs

steps.action: Navigate to conflict logs section or execute API call GET /api/conflicts/logs
steps.expectedResult: Conflict logs interface or API response is displayed showing list of logged conflicts

steps.action: Query or filter logs for resource 'Projector Unit 5' and the timestamp of the recent conflict attempt
steps.expectedResult: Log entry for the conflicting booking attempt is present in the results

steps.action: Open the specific log entry and review its contents
steps.expectedResult: Log entry displays complete details including resource name 'Projector Unit 5', attempted time slot 9:30 AM - 10:30 AM, existing booking time 9:00 AM - 10:00 AM, scheduler username, and conflict type

steps.action: Verify the timestamp in the log entry matches the time when conflict was detected (within acceptable margin of seconds)
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp in log entry accurately reflects the time of conflict detection

steps.action: Verify resource information accuracy by comparing log data with actual resource details
steps.expectedResult: Resource ID, resource name, and resource type in log entry match the actual resource 'Projector Unit 5' details in the system

steps.action: Check log metadata for completeness including user ID, session ID, and conflict resolution status
steps.expectedResult: All metadata fields are populated with accurate information showing unresolved conflict status

postconditions: Conflict is logged in the system with complete and accurate metadata
Log entry is retrievable via both API and admin UI
Original booking for Projector Unit 5 remains unchanged
Conflicting booking attempt was not saved
Audit trail is maintained for compliance purposes

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to log all detected scheduling conflicts for audit and troubleshooting

testCases.title: Verify logging of detected conflicts
preconditions: Scheduler user is logged in with valid credentials
Admin user credentials are available for accessing logs
Logging service is operational and connected to secure database
Existing booking: Resource 'Training Room C' booked from 1:00 PM to 2:00 PM on current date
Admin UI for log access is accessible
API endpoint GET /api/conflicts/logs is operational

steps.action: As Scheduler user, navigate to booking creation page
steps.expectedResult: Booking form is displayed with all required fields

steps.action: Select resource 'Training Room C', enter current date, start time 1:30 PM, end time 2:30 PM to create overlapping booking
steps.expectedResult: Form is populated with conflicting booking details

steps.action: Click 'Submit' button to trigger scheduling conflict
steps.expectedResult: System detects conflict, displays warning message, and blocks booking confirmation

steps.action: Wait 2 seconds to ensure log write operation completes
steps.expectedResult: System processes and writes log entry to database

steps.action: Execute API call GET /api/conflicts/logs with appropriate authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 200 status with JSON response containing array of conflict log entries

steps.action: Parse API response and search for log entry matching resource 'Training Room C' and timestamp of recent conflict
steps.expectedResult: Log entry is present in API response with all required metadata fields: resourceId, resourceName, attemptedStartTime, attemptedEndTime, existingStartTime, existingEndTime, userId, timestamp, conflictType

steps.action: Verify log entry metadata completeness by checking each field contains valid data
steps.expectedResult: All metadata fields are populated: resourceId='Training Room C', attemptedStartTime='1:30 PM', attemptedEndTime='2:30 PM', existingStartTime='1:00 PM', existingEndTime='2:00 PM', userId matches scheduler, timestamp is accurate, conflictType='OVERLAP'

steps.action: Log in to admin UI using admin credentials
steps.expectedResult: Admin dashboard is displayed with navigation menu including conflict logs section

steps.action: Navigate to conflict logs section in admin UI
steps.expectedResult: Conflict logs page is displayed showing list of logged conflicts with search and filter options

steps.action: Verify search functionality by entering resource name 'Training Room C' in search field
steps.expectedResult: Search results are filtered to show only conflicts related to 'Training Room C'

steps.action: Verify filter options by applying date filter for current date
steps.expectedResult: Results are further filtered to show only conflicts from current date

steps.action: Locate and click on the specific log entry for the recent conflict
steps.expectedResult: Detailed view of log entry is displayed showing all metadata fields with accurate information matching API response

postconditions: Conflict is logged with complete metadata in secure database
Log entry is accessible via both API and admin UI
Search and filter functionality is confirmed operational
Audit trail is maintained for the conflict event
No data inconsistency between API and UI log displays

testCases.title: Test log write performance
preconditions: Scheduler user is logged in with valid credentials
Admin user credentials are available for log verification
Performance monitoring tools are configured and active
Multiple resources exist in the system with existing bookings
Logging database has sufficient capacity and is optimized
System is under normal operational load
High-precision timer or monitoring tool is available to measure millisecond-level performance

steps.action: Prepare test data: Identify 5 different resources with existing bookings at various time slots
steps.expectedResult: Test data is documented: Resource1 booked 9:00-10:00, Resource2 booked 10:00-11:00, Resource3 booked 11:00-12:00, Resource4 booked 1:00-2:00, Resource5 booked 2:00-3:00

steps.action: Start performance monitoring tool to track database write operations and response times
steps.expectedResult: Performance monitoring is active and recording metrics

steps.action: Trigger first conflict by attempting to book Resource1 from 9:15 AM to 9:45 AM and record timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detected, warning displayed, timestamp T1 recorded

steps.action: Immediately trigger second conflict by attempting to book Resource2 from 10:15 AM to 10:45 AM and record timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detected, warning displayed, timestamp T2 recorded

steps.action: Immediately trigger third conflict by attempting to book Resource3 from 11:15 AM to 11:45 AM and record timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detected, warning displayed, timestamp T3 recorded

steps.action: Immediately trigger fourth conflict by attempting to book Resource4 from 1:15 PM to 1:45 PM and record timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detected, warning displayed, timestamp T4 recorded

steps.action: Immediately trigger fifth conflict by attempting to book Resource5 from 2:15 PM to 2:45 PM and record timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detected, warning displayed, timestamp T5 recorded

steps.action: Review performance monitoring logs to measure log write duration for each conflict
steps.expectedResult: Performance logs show individual write operation times: Write1, Write2, Write3, Write4, Write5

steps.action: Verify each log write operation completed within 100 milliseconds
steps.expectedResult: All write operations (Write1 through Write5) show duration â‰¤ 100 milliseconds

steps.action: Monitor system performance metrics including CPU usage, memory usage, and database response time during the test
steps.expectedResult: System performance metrics remain within normal operational ranges with no significant spikes or degradation

steps.action: Access conflict logs via API GET /api/conflicts/logs
steps.expectedResult: API responds successfully with all 5 conflict log entries

steps.action: Verify log completeness by checking all 5 conflicts are logged with correct details
steps.expectedResult: All 5 log entries are present with accurate metadata: Resource1-5 conflicts logged with correct timestamps T1-T5, no data loss occurred

steps.action: Verify log entry order and timestamp accuracy
steps.expectedResult: Log entries are ordered chronologically with timestamps matching T1 through T5 within acceptable margin

postconditions: All 5 conflicts are logged successfully without data loss
Each log write operation completed within 100 milliseconds performance requirement
System performance remained stable with no degradation
Database integrity is maintained
Logs are retrievable and complete

testCases.title: Ensure secure access to logs
preconditions: Logging system is operational with access control enabled
Admin user credentials are available with proper permissions
Regular scheduler user credentials are available without admin privileges
Unauthorized user credentials or no credentials are available for negative testing
Conflict logs exist in the database from previous test activities
Encryption at rest is configured for the logging database
Role-based access control (RBAC) is properly configured

steps.action: Attempt to access conflict logs API endpoint GET /api/conflicts/logs without authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 401 Unauthorized status with error message 'Authentication required'

steps.action: Attempt to access conflict logs API endpoint GET /api/conflicts/logs with invalid or expired authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 401 Unauthorized status with error message 'Invalid or expired token'

steps.action: Log in as regular Scheduler user (non-admin) and attempt to access conflict logs via API
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden status with error message 'Insufficient permissions to access conflict logs'

steps.action: Log in as regular Scheduler user and attempt to navigate to conflict logs section in UI
steps.expectedResult: Conflict logs menu option is not visible or clicking it displays 'Access Denied' message

steps.action: Attempt direct URL access to conflict logs page as regular Scheduler user
steps.expectedResult: System redirects to unauthorized page or displays 'Access Denied - Admin privileges required' message

steps.action: Log out and log in as Admin user with proper credentials
steps.expectedResult: Admin dashboard is displayed with full navigation menu including conflict logs access

steps.action: Execute API call GET /api/conflicts/logs with valid admin authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 200 status with JSON response containing conflict log entries

steps.action: Navigate to conflict logs section in admin UI
steps.expectedResult: Conflict logs page is displayed with full access to search, filter, and view log entries

steps.action: Access database server or storage system where conflict logs are stored
steps.expectedResult: Database connection is established with appropriate admin credentials

steps.action: Query the conflict logs table directly and examine data storage format
steps.expectedResult: Log data is stored in encrypted format, sensitive fields are not readable in plain text

steps.action: Verify encryption configuration by checking database encryption settings
steps.expectedResult: Encryption at rest is enabled with appropriate encryption algorithm (e.g., AES-256), encryption keys are properly managed

steps.action: Review access control logs to verify all access attempts are logged
steps.expectedResult: System audit logs show all access attempts including unauthorized attempts with user details and timestamps

steps.action: Verify data encryption policy compliance by reviewing security documentation
steps.expectedResult: Encryption implementation matches organizational security policy requirements for sensitive audit data

postconditions: Unauthorized access attempts are blocked and logged
Admin access is granted and functional
Log data encryption at rest is verified and compliant
Access control mechanisms are functioning correctly
Security audit trail is maintained for all access attempts
No unauthorized data exposure occurred during testing

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to handle concurrent scheduling inputs without conflicts or data loss

testCases.title: Verify no data loss under concurrent scheduling inputs
preconditions: Scheduling system is operational and accessible
Database has transaction support enabled
Test environment configured to support 100 concurrent connections
Test data prepared with valid scheduling inputs for 100 users
Database baseline snapshot taken for comparison
Monitoring tools configured to track database operations

steps.action: Configure load testing tool to simulate 100 concurrent users
steps.expectedResult: Load testing tool successfully configured with 100 user profiles

steps.action: Prepare unique scheduling data for each of the 100 concurrent users with varying resources, times, and dates
steps.expectedResult: 100 unique scheduling requests prepared and validated

steps.action: Execute concurrent submission of all 100 schedules simultaneously via POST /api/schedule/save endpoint
steps.expectedResult: All 100 scheduling requests submitted without connection errors or timeouts

steps.action: Monitor API responses for all 100 requests
steps.expectedResult: All 100 requests return successful HTTP status codes (200 or 201) with confirmation messages

steps.action: Query the database to count total number of saved schedule records
steps.expectedResult: Database contains exactly 100 new schedule records matching the submitted data

steps.action: Verify data integrity by comparing each saved record against original submission data
steps.expectedResult: All 100 records contain accurate and complete data with no corruption or missing fields

steps.action: Check database for duplicate entries or orphaned records
steps.expectedResult: No duplicate or orphaned records found in the database

steps.action: Execute conflict detection algorithm on all saved schedules
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detection runs successfully and identifies all actual conflicts accurately

steps.action: Review conflict detection results against expected conflicts based on test data design
steps.expectedResult: 100% accuracy in conflict detection with no false positives or false negatives

steps.action: Verify database transaction logs for rollback or error entries
steps.expectedResult: Transaction logs show successful commits with no rollbacks or errors

postconditions: All 100 schedules successfully saved in database
Database integrity maintained with no data loss
Conflict detection accuracy verified at 100%
System remains stable and operational
Test data cleaned up or marked for cleanup

testCases.title: Ensure user feedback on concurrent conflicts
preconditions: Scheduling system is operational
Two test user accounts with scheduler role created and authenticated
Shared resource available for scheduling (e.g., Conference Room A)
Real-time notification system enabled
System logging configured and active
Both users have active sessions in the scheduling interface

steps.action: User 1 begins creating a schedule for Conference Room A on 2024-01-15 from 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling form populated with resource and time details for User 1

steps.action: User 2 simultaneously begins creating a schedule for Conference Room A on 2024-01-15 from 10:30 AM to 11:30 AM (overlapping time)
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling form populated with resource and time details for User 2

steps.action: User 1 submits the schedule first
steps.expectedResult: User 1 receives confirmation that schedule was saved successfully

steps.action: User 2 submits the overlapping schedule within 2 seconds of User 1
steps.expectedResult: User 2 immediately receives a conflict alert indicating the resource is already booked during the requested time

steps.action: Verify conflict alert details shown to User 2
steps.expectedResult: Alert displays conflicting booking details including resource name, conflicting time range, and existing booking information

steps.action: Check if User 1 also receives notification about the conflict attempt
steps.expectedResult: User 1 receives notification that another user attempted to book the same resource during their scheduled time

steps.action: User 2 adjusts schedule to Conference Room A from 11:30 AM to 12:30 PM (non-overlapping time)
steps.expectedResult: User 2 successfully modifies the schedule with new time slot

steps.action: User 2 resubmits the adjusted schedule
steps.expectedResult: Schedule saved successfully with confirmation message and no conflict alerts

steps.action: Verify both schedules exist in the system without conflicts
steps.expectedResult: Both User 1 and User 2 schedules are saved and visible in the scheduling dashboard

steps.action: Access system logs and search for concurrent conflict events
steps.expectedResult: Logs contain entries showing the conflict event with timestamps, user IDs, resource details, and conflict resolution outcome

steps.action: Verify log data accuracy by comparing with actual event timeline
steps.expectedResult: Log timestamps and details match the actual sequence of events accurately

postconditions: Both users have successfully saved schedules without conflicts
Conflict alerts were delivered immediately to affected users
System logs contain complete and accurate concurrency conflict data
No data corruption or loss occurred
Users remain authenticated and system is operational

testCases.title: Test system performance under concurrency
preconditions: Scheduling system deployed in test environment matching production specifications
Load testing tool configured and validated
100 concurrent user profiles created with valid credentials
System monitoring tools active (CPU, memory, database connections, response times)
SLA defined with acceptable response time thresholds (e.g., <2 seconds)
Baseline performance metrics captured
Test scheduling data prepared for all 100 users

steps.action: Configure load testing tool to simulate 100 concurrent scheduling users with realistic usage patterns
steps.expectedResult: Load test configured with 100 virtual users ready to execute scheduling operations

steps.action: Start system monitoring tools to track CPU usage, memory consumption, database connections, and response times
steps.expectedResult: All monitoring tools active and recording baseline metrics

steps.action: Initiate load test with gradual ramp-up to 100 concurrent users over 2 minutes
steps.expectedResult: Load test starts successfully with users ramping up smoothly

steps.action: Monitor system response times during the load test for all scheduling operations
steps.expectedResult: Average response time remains within SLA threshold (e.g., <2 seconds) for 95th percentile

steps.action: Verify maximum response time does not exceed critical threshold
steps.expectedResult: Maximum response time stays below critical threshold (e.g., <5 seconds)

steps.action: Monitor CPU usage across all application servers during peak load
steps.expectedResult: CPU usage remains below 80% with no sustained spikes above 90%

steps.action: Monitor memory consumption during concurrent operations
steps.expectedResult: Memory usage remains stable with no memory leaks detected and stays below 85% capacity

steps.action: Monitor database connection pool usage
steps.expectedResult: Database connections managed efficiently with no connection pool exhaustion

steps.action: Monitor disk I/O and network bandwidth utilization
steps.expectedResult: Disk I/O and network bandwidth remain within acceptable limits with no bottlenecks

steps.action: Review application logs for errors, exceptions, or warnings during the load test
steps.expectedResult: No critical errors, exceptions, or system failures logged during the test

steps.action: Verify all 100 concurrent users completed their scheduling operations successfully
steps.expectedResult: 100% success rate for all scheduling operations with no failed transactions

steps.action: Check for any timeout errors or connection failures
steps.expectedResult: Zero timeout errors or connection failures during the entire test duration

steps.action: Sustain 100 concurrent users for 10 minutes to test system stability
steps.expectedResult: System maintains stable performance throughout the sustained load period

steps.action: Gradually ramp down concurrent users and monitor system recovery
steps.expectedResult: System resources return to baseline levels smoothly without issues

postconditions: System maintained response times within SLA during 100 concurrent users
No critical resource exhaustion occurred
Zero errors or failures logged during the test
System remains operational and stable
Performance metrics documented for analysis
Test data cleaned up from the system

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to provide detailed conflict metadata to understand and resolve scheduling issues

testCases.title: Verify detailed conflict metadata display
preconditions: Scheduling system is operational and accessible
Test user with scheduler role is authenticated
At least one existing schedule in the system for Conference Room A on 2024-01-15 from 2:00 PM to 3:00 PM
Conflict detection mechanism is enabled
Dashboard interface is accessible
Conflict severity classification rules are configured

steps.action: Create a new schedule for Conference Room A on 2024-01-15 from 2:30 PM to 3:30 PM (overlapping with existing booking)
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling form accepts the input and prepares for submission

steps.action: Submit the conflicting schedule
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and displays a conflict alert immediately

steps.action: Review the conflict alert message for metadata completeness
steps.expectedResult: Alert includes booking IDs (both existing and attempted), resource name (Conference Room A), conflicting time range (2:30 PM - 3:00 PM), and conflict timestamp

steps.action: Verify the alert displays the user who created the existing conflicting booking
steps.expectedResult: Alert shows the name or ID of the user who owns the existing booking

steps.action: Check if the alert includes descriptions or titles of both bookings
steps.expectedResult: Both booking descriptions/titles are displayed in the alert

steps.action: Navigate to the conflicts dashboard or conflict management section
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully showing list of conflicts

steps.action: Locate the recently triggered conflict in the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Conflict appears in the dashboard list with summary information

steps.action: Click on the conflict entry to view detailed metadata
steps.expectedResult: Detailed conflict view opens displaying comprehensive metadata

steps.action: Verify metadata includes both booking IDs
steps.expectedResult: Both the existing booking ID and attempted booking ID are displayed

steps.action: Verify metadata includes complete resource information
steps.expectedResult: Resource details displayed including resource name, type, location, and capacity

steps.action: Verify metadata includes accurate timestamps
steps.expectedResult: Timestamps shown for conflict detection time, existing booking creation time, and attempted booking submission time

steps.action: Check for conflict severity indicator in the metadata display
steps.expectedResult: Severity indicator is clearly visible (e.g., High, Medium, Low or color-coded)

steps.action: Verify the severity level matches the expected classification based on conflict type
steps.expectedResult: Severity level is appropriate (e.g., High for complete overlap, Medium for partial overlap)

steps.action: Check if metadata includes overlap duration information
steps.expectedResult: Overlap duration displayed (e.g., 30 minutes overlap)

postconditions: Conflict alert displayed with complete metadata
Dashboard shows conflict with detailed information
Severity indicator clearly visible and accurate
No data corruption or system errors
User remains authenticated and can continue working

testCases.title: Test metadata retrieval performance
preconditions: Scheduling system is operational
API endpoint GET /api/conflicts/details is accessible
At least one conflict exists in the system with ID known for testing
Test user with scheduler role has valid API authentication token
Unauthorized test user account created without scheduler role
Performance monitoring tools configured to measure response times
Network conditions are stable

steps.action: Prepare API request to GET /api/conflicts/details with valid conflict ID and authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API request properly formatted with required headers and parameters

steps.action: Start timer and send API request to retrieve conflict metadata
steps.expectedResult: API request sent successfully

steps.action: Measure the response time from request initiation to complete response receipt
steps.expectedResult: Response received within 1 second (1000ms or less)

steps.action: Verify HTTP status code of the response
steps.expectedResult: HTTP status code 200 OK returned

steps.action: Parse the response body to extract conflict metadata
steps.expectedResult: Response body contains valid JSON with conflict metadata structure

steps.action: Verify presence of booking IDs in the response
steps.expectedResult: Both conflicting booking IDs are present in the response

steps.action: Verify presence of resource information in the response
steps.expectedResult: Resource name, type, and other resource details are included

steps.action: Verify presence of timestamp fields in the response
steps.expectedResult: All required timestamp fields (conflict detection time, booking times) are present

steps.action: Verify presence of conflict severity indicator in the response
steps.expectedResult: Severity field is present with valid value

steps.action: Verify presence of user information for conflicting bookings
steps.expectedResult: User IDs or names for both bookings are included

steps.action: Validate data accuracy by comparing response data with database records
steps.expectedResult: All metadata fields match the actual conflict data in the database

steps.action: Verify no required fields are missing or null
steps.expectedResult: All mandatory fields contain valid non-null values

steps.action: Repeat API request 5 times to verify consistent performance
steps.expectedResult: All 5 requests return responses within 1 second

steps.action: Prepare API request using unauthorized user credentials (user without scheduler role)
steps.expectedResult: API request formatted with unauthorized user token

steps.action: Send API request to GET /api/conflicts/details with unauthorized credentials
steps.expectedResult: API request sent successfully

steps.action: Verify the response status code for unauthorized access
steps.expectedResult: HTTP status code 403 Forbidden or 401 Unauthorized returned

steps.action: Verify no conflict metadata is returned in the response body
steps.expectedResult: Response body contains error message indicating access denied, with no sensitive conflict data exposed

steps.action: Check system logs for unauthorized access attempt
steps.expectedResult: Security log contains entry for denied access attempt with user ID and timestamp

postconditions: Metadata retrieval performance verified at under 1 second
All required metadata fields confirmed present and accurate
Access control verified working correctly
Unauthorized access properly denied and logged
System remains secure and operational
